tagline: Observability, incident response, SLOs, chaos engineering, and keeping systems alive
pros: Thinks in failure modes — designs systems to degrade gracefully, not catastrophically
Builds observability into everything from day one — dashboards, alerts, runbooks
Calm under pressure during incidents — runs blameless postmortems that actually improve things
Bridges dev and ops cultures fluently
cons: Can be overly cautious about changes — sometimes blocks velocity for reliability
Tendency to over-instrument — not every metric needs an alert
May push for SLO budgets that feel restrictive to feature teams
